claim_target: On April 23, 2018, a portion of the NH-707A highway near Chamoli district in Uttarakhand collapsed, causing a bus full of passengers to fall into a gorge, resulting in several fatalities and injuries.
query: In which Indian state did a bus full of passengers fall into a gorge due to a collapsed portion of NH-707A on April 23, 2018?
evidence: Oct 9, 2023 07:35 IST Six people were killed and 27 others were injured after a bus plunged into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Nainital district on Sunday, news agency PTI reported. There were 33 passengers on the bus at the time of the accident. The bus was coming from Haryana and carrying people from Hisar. The vehicle was in Nainital's Kaladhungi area when the accident took place.

query: What kind of accident occurred on NH-707A near Chamoli district in Uttarakhand on April 23, 2018?
evidence: The traffic movement on the Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district was blocked after stones rolled off a hill near Baba Ashram Karnaprayag, reported ANI citing officials. Traffic was temporarily suspended after stones slipped down the hill in Karnaprayag town of Chamoli, district police said. On Saturday, a portion of the Badrinath National Highway (NH-7) was damaged as the water level of the Lambagad drain rose due to the heavy showers in the Chamoli since Friday night, ANI mentioned. A 50-metre stretch was washed away after incessant rainfall.
edited_claim: On April 23, 2018, portion of Badrinath highway (NH-7) near Karnaprayag town in Chamoli district was blocked after stones rolled off a hill near Baba Ashram Karnaprayag due to heavy rainfall. Traffic was temporarily suspended after stones slipped down the hill in Karnaprayag town of Chamoli, district police said. No bus fell into a gorge or any fatalities reported.

query: What were the consequences of the collapse on NH-707A near Chamoli district in Uttarakhand on April 23, 2018?
evidence: Background Disaster struck Uttarakhand’s Chamoli District on 7 February 2021, when a massive flash flood ravaged through the valleys of the Rishi Ganga, Dhauliganga and Alaknanda rivers. More than 70 people have been confirmed dead and another 134 people reported missing . The flood swept away the unfinished Tapovan Vishnugad Hydropower Project and inflicted substantial damage on the Rishi Ganga Hydropower Project. Even as rescue and relief efforts were underway, a glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) was suggested as the reason for the flood, possibly triggered by glacier collapse.

claim_target: Siddique is a Malayalam film actor, known for his work in the Indian film industry based in Kerala, India.

evidence: Siddique Born Siddique Ismail ( 1954-03-25 ) 25 March 1954 Kochi , Kerala , India Died ( 2023-08-08 ) 8 August 2023 (aged 68) Kochi , Kerala , India Occupations Film director producer screenwriter actor Spouse Sajitha ​ ( m. 1984) ​ Children 3 Siddique Ismail (25 March 1954 or 1955 – 8 August 2023) was an Indian film director, producer, screenwriter and actor who predominantly worked in Malayalam cinema . edited_claim: Siddique Ismail (born March 25, 1954) was an Indian film director, producer, screenwriter and actor who predominantly worked in Malayalam cinema. He was born in Kochi, Kerala, India. claim_target: Mithila Palkar is an Indian actress who gained recognition through her YouTube channel and web series such as "Girl in the City" and "Little Things." Similar to Park Shin-hye, she started her career at a young age and has become a popular figure in Indian web series and films.
query: Which sport-themed Indian film did Ritika Singh star in alongside Madhavan, titled "Saala Khadoos"?
evidence: Final round ) is a 2016 Indian sports drama film written and directed by Sudha Kongara . Filmed simultaneously in Tamil and Hindi , with the latter being titled as Saala Khadoos ( transl. Bloody Grouch ), the film stars R. Madhavan as boxing coach who is ignored by the boxing association, tries to accomplish his dream by training an amateur boxer, Madhi, played by Ritika Singh in her acting debut. Kongara wrote the script for the film in early 2011, and approached Madhavan for the leading role, for whom the film marks his comeback to Tamil cinema after four years.

Similar to Park Shin-hye, she started her career at a young age and has become a popular figure in Indian web series and films. Ritika Singh starred in the sport-themed Indian film "Irudhi Suttru" alongside Madhavan, titled "Saala Khadoos" in Hindi.
